title: Average Velocity Equation
text: If s(t) is the position of an object moving along a coordinate axis, the average velocity of the object over a time interval [a,t] is V_avg=[s(t)-s(a)]/(t-a)

title: Plugging In
text: In this question, $$t$$ goes from $$4$$ to $$4.01$$. Plug $$4.01s$$ in for $$t$$ and 4s in for a in the previous equation.
